publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: ... consciousness, Duṣkṛta-sin. The water not containing animal ... ///
if he does not see (the water) carefully, animal stll (is there) ///
Dadurch wurde er [scil. der Haushalter] sehr verärgert [wtl. verletzt].
Thereby he [i.e. the householder] was very [much] hurt/upset.
(Buddha heard and blamed. || If a monk ... a house where sexual intercourse is going on or about to be practised ///
Pāt.-sin. || How is the sin here? In order to embarrass the householder ///
Wie ist hier das Vergehen? Den Haushalter zu verletzen ...
What is the offense here? To upset/hurt the householder ...
Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī. There Upananda in the house ///
(Upananda) was sitting. Another monk came to this house for alms. [Upananda] ///
... I did order to give it as alms to you. Buddha heard and blamed ///
the sitting with ... a woman at the hidden place and the covered place ///
he sits with ... a woman at the hidden place and the covered place ///
... he gave to her only one. Therefore (the two wandering religious mendicant women) ///

p.note: Upper, lower, and left margins, and almost the complete string hole space are preserved.
According to 95, "[w]ritten in medium ductus, and clearly preserved, it is the left edge of a large seven line manuscript. A small number which appears to be '70' is on verso."
aiporne: ai has been corrected from e

list.item: a1 ... consciousness, Duṣkṛta-sin. The water not containing animal ... /// a2 if he does not see (the water) carefully, animal stll (is there) /// a3 ... [Upananda] /// a4 Therefore he embarrassed much. [Upananda] /// a5 (Buddha heard and blamed. || If a monk ... a house where sexual intercourse is going on or about to be practised /// a6 Pāt.-sin. || How is the sin here? In order to embarrass the householder /// a7 Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī. There Upananda in the house /// b1 (Upananda) was sitting. Another monk came to this house for alms. [Upananda] /// b2 ... I did order to give it as alms to you. Buddha heard and blamed /// b3 the sitting with ... a woman at the hidden place and the covered place /// b4 he sits with ... a woman at the hidden place and the covered place /// b5 the woman sellers /// b6 ... two [divine] wandering religious mendicant women /// b7 ... he gave to her only one. Therefore (the two wandering religious mendicant women) ///

Upper, lower, and left margins, and almost the complete string hole space are preserved.

According to [[Broomhead I]]: 95, "[w]ritten in medium ductus, and clearly preserved, it is the left edge of a large seven line manuscript. A small number which appears to be '70' is on verso."

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a4 Dadurch wurde er [scil. der Haushalter] sehr verärgert [wtl. verletzt]. 262
a6 Wie ist hier das Vergehen? Den Haushalter zu verletzen ... 262, fn. 1


[[Broomhead I]]: 100-101 translates:

a1 ... spirit [then there is] du. Water without animals ...

a2 [And] if he does not look carefully, even [and] animal

a3 yweṃṣkai klauṣai : Upananda ...

a4 Thereby he will be greatly harmed. Upananda ...

a5 [he] blamed [them]. Whichever monk ... with people eating

a6 Here there is a crime, such as will harm a householder

a7 The Buddha was in Śrāvasti [and] there [also was] Upananda at home.

b1 he sat. Another monk went into the house for alms [and] Upananda ...

b2 I ordered you to give that as alms. The Buddha heard [of it] [and] scolded [them.].

b3 To sit in secret under a cover with a nun [or] a woman [is] pāyti.

b4 If he should sit with anun or a woman under cover in secret [then he commits a pāyti sin.]

b5 Trade with female traders

b6 ... with female parivrājakas

b7 He gave her only one portion. Thereupon ...

[[Broomhead I]]: 101 gives the following summary of pāt. 41-44:

No. 41. concerns a monk drinking water, in which he knows there to be small animals.

No. 42. concerns a bhikṣu forcibly sitting down in a house where the people are sitting eating. śle śwātsicce = skt. sabhojana kule

No. 43. concerns a monk forcibly sitting down in a house, where people are eating, alone with a woman.

No. 44. concerns a bhikṣu giving food with his own hand to naked heretics, pārivrājakas or female parivrājakas.


TEKST OGI nog niet vergeleken

a1 -tse īme du • snai luwa war ne- /// anaiśai|(a)|naiśai a2 mā lakaṃ luwo rano o- /// a3 yweṃṣkai klauṣai • upa- /// a4 tusa māka myāyate up(a)n(a)nd(e) /// nāksate|(nā)|ksate a5 • || mäksu no ṣamāne śle śwatsicce l· – /// a6 -trä ī || tane traṅko mäkte mäsketär osta-ṣmeñcai miyassi /// a7 pañäkte śrāvastine mäskītär omp upanande ostne ·e /// b1 ṣami • +S+ +NP+ allek|allekä ksa ṣamāne ++ cau|cew ostäś(c) piṃtwāt śem ++ upana(nde) /// b2 -ne ñäś tu|tū tañ yātkawa piṃtwāt aitsi • pañäkte klyauṣa nāksate /// aśiyai|(aśi)|yai b3 klainämpa • enestai aiporne lamal(l)e /// aśiyai|(aśi)|yai b4 klainmpa enestai aiporne ṣa(mä)ṃ /// b5 käryor pläṅṣiññana(mpa) /// b6 yane parivrājakāñcan(ampa) /// b7 -w tāy no ṣeme ka wasa • tus(a) ///

div.p: <citedRange>100-101</citedRange></bibl> translates: </p><p>a1 ... spirit [then there is] du. Water without animals ... </p><p>a2 [And] if he does not look carefully, even [and] animal </p><p>a3 yweṃṣkai klauṣai : Upananda ... </p><p>a4 Thereby he will be greatly harmed. Upananda ... </p><p>a5 [he] blamed [them]. Whichever monk ... with people eating </p><p>a6 Here there is a crime, such as will harm a householder </p><p>a7 The Buddha was in Śrāvasti [and] there [also was] Upananda at home. </p><p>b1 he sat. Another monk went into the house for alms [and] Upananda ... </p><p>b2 I ordered you to give that as alms. The Buddha heard [of it] [and] scolded [them.]. </p><p>b3 To sit in secret under a cover with a nun [or] a woman [is] pāyti. </p><p>b4 If he should sit with anun or a woman under cover in secret [then he commits a pāyti sin.] </p><p>b5 Trade with female traders </p><p>b6 ... with female parivrājakas </p><p>b7 He gave her only one portion. Thereupon ... </p><p><bibl><title corresp="ref:broomhead1962"/><citedRange>101</citedRange></bibl> gives the following summary of pāt. 41-44: </p><p>No. 41. concerns a monk drinking water, in which he knows there to be small animals. </p><p>No. 42. concerns a bhikṣu forcibly sitting down in a house where the people are sitting eating. śle śwātsicce = skt. sabhojana kule</p><p>No. 43. concerns a monk forcibly sitting down in a house, where people are eating, alone with a woman. </p><p>No. 44. concerns a bhikṣu giving food with his own hand to naked heretics, pārivrājakas or female parivrājakas.</p><p>TEKST OGI nog niet vergeleken</p></project_comment>
